sen.j: 根金身（ねのかねみ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: NE no Kanemi is a person who lived in Asuka period, although his birth and death dates are not known.
NE no Kanemi is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka period, although his birth and death dates are not known.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: NE no Kanemi is a person who lived during Japan's Asuka period, although his birth and death dates are not known.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「ねのかねみ」で同じ。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name reads "NE no Kanemi," the same as in modern syllabary characters.
In the old Japanese kana syllabary, his name reads "NE no Kanemi," the same as in the modern kana syllabary.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese kana syllabary, his name reads "NE no Kanemi," the same as in the modern kana syllabary.
His "kabane" name, a hereditary title which describes his family's relationship with the central government, was "Muraji."
His "kabane" name, a hereditary title which describes his family's relationship with the central government, was "Muraji."
His "kabane" name, a hereditary title which describes his family's relationship with the central government, was "Muraji."

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で、都を脱出した大津皇子に同行した。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, NE accompanied Prince Otsu's escape journey from the capital.
During the Jinshin War of 672, NE accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルのネイティブチェックを参考に修正しました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War of 672, NE accompanied Prince Otsu in his escape from the capital.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の勃発時、金身は近江宮がある大津市にいたらしい。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, Kanemi was believed to be in Otsu city where Omi no miya was located.
When the Jinshin War broke out, Kanemi was believed to be in Otsu where Omi no miya was located.
sen.cmt: リンク表記で「大津市」となっていますが当時は「大津」なので（web表記も「大津」）、Cityは削除しました。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, Kanemi was believed to be in Otsu where Omi no miya was located.

sen.j: 大海人皇子が挙兵を決めたとき、その子高市皇子と大津皇子は敵の本拠である大津を脱し、二手に分かれて父のあとを追った。
sen.e: When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarter, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarters, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

When Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) decided to raise an army, his two sons, Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) and Prince Otsu, left Otsu where their enemy had a headquarters, and followed their father, each taking a different route.

sen.j: このうち大津皇子の一行は25日深夜に伊勢国の鈴鹿関に到達し、翌朝朝明郡の迹太川の辺で合流を果たした。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka barrier in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too River in Asake-no-kori.
sen.cmt: 25日が何月かが明記されていませんので、日付のみ訳しました。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too-gawa River in Asake-no-kori.
sen.cmt: 鈴鹿関の訳語は用語集に従いました。Too RiverもToo-gawa Riverに修正しました。
sen.e: Of the two parties, Prince Otsu arrived at the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint in the Ise Province around midnight on the 25th, and joined the other party by the Too-gawa River in Asake-no-kori.

sen.j: 根金身はこの一行の中にいた。
sen.e: NE no Kanemi was a member of the Prince Otsu party.
NE no Kanemi was a member of the Prince Otsu party.
NE no Kanemi was a member of the Prince Otsu party.

sen.j: ともに朝明郡にたどりついたのは、大分恵尺、難波三綱、駒田忍人、山辺安摩呂、小墾田猪手、埿部視枳、大分稚臣、漆部友背であった。
sen.e: Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, and NURIBE no Tomose.

Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, and NURIBE no Tomose.

Other members who arrived in Asake-no-kori with Prince Otsu were OKIDA no Esaka, NANIWA no Mitsuna, KOMADA no Oshihito, YAMAHE no Yasumaro, OHARITA no Ite, HATSUKASHIBE no Shiki, OKIDA no Wakaomi, and NURIBE no Tomose.

sen.j: この後の内戦で根金身が果たした活動については記録がない。
sen.e: There are no records about achievements of NE no Kanemi in the civil war afterwards.
There are no records about achievements of NE no Kanemi in the civil war afterwards.
There are no records about achievements of NE no Kanemi in the civil war afterwards.
